info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 5 at 9:35PM EDT until August 6 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Peachtree City GA
info.description:
FFWFFC
The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Central Chattahoochee County in west central Georgia... Southern Muscogee County in west central Georgia...
* Until 1230 AM EDT.
* At 935 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Columbus, Cusseta, North Fort Benning, Fort Benning/Lawson Army Air Fld, Sand Hill, Vista Terrace, Benning Hills, Custer Road Terrace, Battle Park, Benning Park, Saint Marys Hills, Carter Acres, Jamestown/South Fort Benning, Kenwood, Edgewood, Highland Park, Eelbeck/West Fort Benning and Avondale.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Spring Creek, Halloca Creek, Hichitee Creek, Wolf Creek, Pine Knot Creek, Tiger Creek, Dozier Creek, Bull Creek, Ochillee Creek, Steam Mill Creek, Chattahoochee River, Spring Branch, Lindsey Creek, Randall Creek, Little Pine Knot Creek, Lemert Creek, Cooper Creek and Upatoi Creek.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
